body.p:
To his excellency B McGoffin Esqr
Govener of Ky

your petitioners represent that Sometime since 1858 E B Treadway H B Hampton D B Capps W Glass & H F Hensley became the security of one B Broun for his appearance in the ousley circuit court to answer a charge of fellony to wit Poligamy they state that Broun failed to appear in discharge of said recognizance the consequence of which was a forfeiture and Judgment was rendered thereon against said securities for the whole amount $250,, at the last term of the ousley cirucit court they state that Broun has left the commonwealth that it was impossible for his securities to bring him up to Justice they state that said securities entered into said Broun before an examining court and that there was the circumstances of Brouns Guilt was but slight on the trial the proof conduced to show that he had been married twice but it failed to prove that stu ^the first wife^ was alive an the probabilty is she was dead they state that Broun was considered a good citizen till he Absconded
they state furthermore that they donot believe that the proof ever would have convicted Broun altho the grand Jury found an indictment the circuit Judge was of opinion that the proof was not sufficient to convict him the case being stated to him they failed to prove the first marrage in fact as the law requires they failed to prove that the first wife was alive as the law requires in the absence of which the law presumes him innocent this was the state of case when the securities went entered into the bond the securities suffered Judgement to go against them believing as your petitioners do that the case presented strong considerations for the interposition of the executive clemency they think that it is the wish of all persons acquainted with the facts that said fine be remitted & they therefore hope your clemency will be moved in their behalf that the fine be remitted and for every thing else they right to pray for

E. B. Treadway S. O. C
